Text:
`o.getClass().getDeclaredFields()` will return an array of [`Field`][1] instances. For each `Field` `f` in your array, you can access it's value with `f.get(o)`.


  [1]: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/reflect/Field.html#get%28java.lang.Object%29

`o.getClass().getDeclaredFields()` will return an array of [`Field`][1] instances. For each `Field` `f` in your array, you can access it's value with `f.get(o)`.

---

**Edit** Thank you to @MarkoTopolnik for pointing this out: if you plan to read non-public fields, be sure to first invoke `f.setAccessible(true)` before getting their values.

  [1]: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/reflect/Field.html#get%28java.lang.Object%29
